posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello there, Killinius, good to meet you!

If I'm right, this is the Greedy Dwarf build you've been looking at. The Monk level is taken so Monk UBAB can come into play. That is, where normally your attacks per round (APR) decrease by 5 each time you get another attempt (for example, an AB of 45/40/35/30), with 1 level of Monk - and if you take either Unarmed or Kama - it only decreases by 3 (so, in the above example, you'd have 45/42/39/36). Which means you'd have a better chance of hitting beyond your first attempt. And you'd get more attempts as well (up to 10 per round, but that doesn't apply in this case). Hope that makes sense.

Unfortunately, I know with Arelith you need to take 3 levels in a class when you first take it, and it's only a level 30 PW, so you're a bit stumped with this particular build. @Zanithar, where are you?

None of what you're wanting falls within my boathouse, so I hope someone else can come along soon for you.

Cheers, and welcome again

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
As I said before, I ain't an Arelith player, however, I think we might need to drill down to the basics here - both in terms in what you need to have and what you can have - before we get too confused.

So, you're a dwarf. That gives you 7 pre-epic general feats and 4 epic ones (we can look at bonus feats later). You say you want Dwarven Defender. That's 2 feats gone straight away (Dodge and Toughness - and don't forget you need 13+ DEX to get Dodge).

You also say you want to be a trapsmith. So you need some Rogue (even without the Craft skills). INT governs your ability to find (via Search) and disable/recover (via Disable Traps) traps set by others. If you want to set your own traps, that's DEX, as is Open Lock. Armour check penalties apply to your ability to successfully set traps, so you'd need to strip off before doing so if you're in full plate - even if you take Skill Mastery as a Rogue bonus feat (which grants take 20 on any trap skill check, even in combat).

So, given you'll be looking to squeeze what you can from at least Disable Trap, Open Lock, Search, Set Trap, Tumble and UMD - let alone cross-classing Spellcraft (to help saves v spells) and a detection skill (Listen or Spot). That's 8 skills you want to maximize (let's ignore the Disable/Set Trap synergy for now, along with other details). So let's see how close we can get to that 264 total (it's actually less than that, but it's not a bad starting point).

Dwarven Defender gives you 2 skill points (+INT modifier) per level, and Rogue 8 (+INT mod) (x4 at level 1). If you had a 0 INT modifier, you'd need all 30 levels to be Rogue (1x32 and 29x8 = 264). So you're really going to have to think about those Dwarven Defender levels.

To be honest, I'm not all that sure what DwD brings to a build that's crying out to be DEX and INT based. Fighter, while not as exotic, does seem to offer more - it gives bonus feats and doesn't cost any - and is a dwarf's preferred class, so there's no xp penalty.

Have a mull, Killinius, and see what you think.
